alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Monmouth County through 415 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Freehold, or 12 miles west of Asbury Park, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Howell, Marlboro, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Highlands, Farmingdale, East Freehold, West Freehold, Adelphia, Yorketown, Elberon, Navesink, Collingwood Park, Lincroft and Freewood Acres. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 30. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 100 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and southern New Jersey.
